cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language generation. It also involves the use of sequence-to-sequence models, which are commonly used in natural language processing. 

The paper also involves the use of information retrieval techniques to retrieve relevant comments, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. 

Additionally, the paper proposes a combined approach of retrieval and generation methods, which involves the use of machine learning techniques. This suggests that it could also belong to the cs.LG (Learning) sub-category. 

The paper also involves the use of attention mechanisms and copy mechanisms, which are commonly used in deep learning models. This suggests that it could also belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper involves the use of a scorer to retrieve informative and relevant comments, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
